alert.note: Alert for Ascension; Assumption; East Baton Rouge; Iberville; Livingston; St. James (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 14 at 1:12PM CST until December 14 at 4:15PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: The National Weather Service in New Orleans has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Ascension Parish in southeastern Louisiana... North Central Assumption Parish in southeastern Louisiana... Southern East Baton Rouge Parish in southeastern Louisiana... Southeastern Iberville Parish in southeastern Louisiana... Central Livingston Parish in southeastern Louisiana... Northwestern St. James Parish in southeastern Louisiana... * Until 415 PM CST. * At 112 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Gonzales, Donaldsonville, St. Gabriel, White Castle, Livingston, Sorrento, French Settlement, Port Vincent, Springfield, Prairieville, Geismar, Whitehall, Belle Rose, Paincourtville and Killian. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 170 and 188. Interstate 12 between mile markers 17 and 30. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: Ascension; Assumption; East Baton Rouge; Iberville; Livingston; St. James
